title.narrative: 4.4 SP - SITUATION OF CHILDREN MON

description.narrative: 104/004 By 2020, Government partners have increased capacities to monitor the situation of girls and boys and their multidimensional vulnerabilities and risks., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Data And Child Protection, Evaluation And Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, an enhanced policy environment and national and sub-national systems are in place for the realization of child rights, with a focus on equity, guided by knowledge and evidence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 104/004 By 2020, Government partners have increased capacities to monitor the situation of girls and boys and theirmultidimensional vulnerabilities and risks.

description.narrative: In collaboration with the Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics (BBS), UNICEF promoted disaggregated SDG monitoring by supporting sub-national level MICS, 2019 results production, developing methodological guidelines and building Government capacity on SDG metadata. In addition, UNICEF provided technical support to BBS to generate thematic data on education and water quality in order to help identify priorities as part of UNICEF’s next five-year cooperation framework (2022-2026) with the Government. UNICEF strengthened its existing partnerships with the World Bank and Access to Information to continue monitoring the socio-economic impact of COVID-19 for an evidence-based response for children in the recovery phase. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:23/12/2021
